title: Lead Development Representative
content:
Precisely is the leader in data integrity. We empower businesses to make more confident decisions based on trusted data through a unique combination of software, data enrichment products and strategic services. What does this mean to you? For starters, it means joining a company focused on delivering outstanding innovation and support that helps customers increase revenue, lower costs and reduce risk. In fact, Precisely powers better decisions for more than 12,000 global organizations, including 99 of the Fortune 100. Precisely's 2500 employees are unified by four company core values that are central to who we are and how we operate: Openness, Determination, Individuality, and Collaboration. We are committed to career development for our employees and offer opportunities for growth, learning and building community. With a "work from anywhere" culture, we celebrate diversity in a distributed environment with a presence in 30 countries as well as 20 offices in over 5 continents. Learn more about why it's an exciting time to join Precisely!Intro and job overview:
The Lead Development Representative (LDR) will be responsible for conducting lead analysis, process, and project management activities, all while supporting their assigned business development/sales team. This unit-level LDR will be responsible for key objectives dedicated to helping their assigned team operate efficiently. Organization is key for a successful LDR, in order to stay on track to meet their project objectives. 
Responsibilities and Duties: 
Become knowledgeable in Precisely’s products and services so you are able to effectively support your sales team. Understand the value proposition of products and services.This includes mastering product training and sales methodology.
Lead Analysis

Generate lead reporting via Salesforce, Tableau, and/or external reporting tools to track team performance and report to the first-line manager
Cross-check inbound and outbound lead assignments in Salesforce to ensure the sales team is assigned appropriate leads based on industry/geography/account name
Work with first-line manager to inspect lead and opportunity generation in Salesforce – check for quality, process execution, and completion

Organization & Process

Work with and understand various BDR prospecting tools, with the ability to help your team execute goals in these platforms
Work with first-line manager and SVP on weekly, monthly and quarterly basis to report numbers and trends for meetings
Stay up-to-date on all Precisely updates and relevant news that might impact your team. Share updates internally as needed.
Attend miscellaneous calls and meetings with your first-line manager ,or independently when needed, and report back
Assist in ad-hoc reporting requests from management when needed.
Interact regularly with all areas of Marketing and Sales, including the Operations team, to discuss process
Ability to learn and understand various prospecting platforms such as, but not limited to: ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Outreach, etc.
Provide weekly/monthly updates to your manager on individual activity 

Requirements and Qualifications:

+ 2 years of experience in business operations or customer service
Extremely organized and detail-oriented
Ability to multi-task
Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
Analytical background required
Willing to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. 
Goal-oriented, highly confident, self-motivated, adaptable 
Experience using Microsoft Excel, Salesforce, Tableau, Outreach, ZoomInfo and LinkedIn Sales Navigator preferred 

#LI-ZB1

demographic_questions.description: We are required to compile the following information for statistical purposes in order to comply with certain federal regulations relating to Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action requirements. The information you provide is strictly on a voluntary basis, and the content of the information will not affect your eligibility for employment. Likewise, if you choose not to provide this information it will not affect your eligibility for employment in any way.

answer_options.label: Hispanic or Latino - A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.
White (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.
Black or African American (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.

Asian (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent, including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands,

American Indian or Alaska Native (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America ), and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.

Two or More Races (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person who identifies with more than one of the following, as defined above: White; Black or African American; Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander; Asian; or American Indian or Alaska Native.

questions.label: Do you think of yourself as:

Do you now, or will you in the future, require a visa or any type of immigration sponsorship for work authorization in the country you are working from (e.g., H-1B, OPT, F1, dependent visa)?  (if hired, verification will be required consistent with federal law.)

If you answered yes to the above question, you have now or will require future immigration sponsorship, please state the type visa or sponsorship you have now or will require along with the expiration date of current status.
